thread.title: Soccer star Bastian Schweinsteiger may sue over Nazi doll
thread.title_full: Soccer star Bastian Schweinsteiger may sue over Nazi doll - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Soccer star Bastian Schweinsteiger may sue over Nazi doll
text:
Paul Ellis (Getty)/Dragon In Dream German soccer star Bastian Schweinsteiger is contemplating legal action against a Hong Kong toy company for creating a Nazi figurine that resembles him. German soccer player Bastian Schweinsteiger isn’t getting a kick out of a Nazi doll that he believes shares his likeness.
The Manchester United midfielder is considering taking legal action against Hong Kong-based toy company Dragon in Dream, that created a figurine that bears an uncanny resemblance to the soccer star, BBC reported.
The toy, which costs about $120, dons a grey uniform with a swastika and Nazi eagle insignia on its coat and headgear.
“This is a clear violation of Schweinsteiger’s personality rights,” lawyer Ulrich Amelung told the German newspaper Bild.
“Everyone has rights to their own image. To see him as a swastika-bearing Wehrmacht soldier also constitutes a gross defamation and insult.”
Dragon In Dream "WWII Army Supply Duty - Bastian." The toy company did not return a Daily News request for comment, but a company spokesperson did tell Bild, “We don’t sell any figures which resemble footballers. It is a complete coincidence that the figure ‘Bastian’ looks like Schweinsteiger.”
The doll’s name, “Bastian,” however, might be a dead giveaway.
“We thought that all Germans look like that,” the spokesperson said.
“Bastian is also a very common name in Germany.”
brobins@nydailynews.com
